titles.title: There is a name I love to hear

properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1 v6 c1 v7 c1

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: There is a name I love to hear, I love to speak its worth; It sounds like music in mine ear, The sweetest name on earth.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: O how I love Jesus, O how I love Jesus, O how I love Jesus, Because He first loved me!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: It tells me of a Savior’s love, Who died to set me free; It tells me of His precious blood, The sinner’s perfect plea.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: It tells me what my Father hath In store for every day, And though I tread a darksome path, Yields sunshine all the way.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: It tells of One whose loving heart Can feel my deepest woe; Who in my sorrow bears a part, That none can bear below.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Jesus, the name I love so well, The name I love to hear! No saint on earth its worth can tell, No heart conceive how dear.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: This name shall shed its fragrance still Along this thorny road, Shall sweetly smooth the rugged hill That leads me up to God.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: And there, with all the blood-bought throng, From sin and sorrow free, I’ll sing the new eternal song Of Jesus’ love to me.
